result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R Mattke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Harassment-Conduct or Acts. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Harassment-Conduct or Acts. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph R Mattke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Copy of $1,081 cashier's check that def gave to his probation agent on 10/10/14. The $1,081 is exactly what he owed the court in this case (CT1 DOC collect ~ $176 court costs + CT2 NON-DOC collect ~ $452.50 court costs + CT3 NON-DOC collect ~ $452.50 court costs = $1,081); His probation agent - Carrie Roehl - had him pay the full $1,081 to her.  I spoke w/Josh at Jefferson P&P & he logged into the DOC financials...because CT2 & CT3 were NOT DOC collect, the DOC cashiers unit applied the money to other costs/fees due from the def & DOC will keep the overage until a later date. He said that the def currently has a credit of $615.85 & still owes $80 in supervision fees; that the credit will probably remain on Hold until the def. is done w/probation & the credit will NOT be sent to the court.

I relayed all this info to the def - gave him his options & moved the due date to 2/1/15 to give him more time to decide w/route he wants to take.

Case called at 8:50 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Joseph R Mattke in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt submits plea paperwork 
Service of the AMENDED complaint admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1, #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling, per Agent
--Contact with victim only if both the victim & Agent approve
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge

Days credit for time already served: 1 day

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $250 + costs = $452.50; due in 60 days. Non-payment results in a 19 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 

On Count #3, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $250 + costs = $452.50; due in 60 days. Non-payment results in a 19 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
Recess: 9:12 am
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Proposed Stipulation and Order for Continuance of the 9/5/14 Preliminary Hearing
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant requested that SPD appear for bond purposes only. A financial evaluation was not conducted.
General objection to the use of hearsay at preliminary hearing
Preliminary hearing on September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:18 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Joseph R Mattke appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that SPD appears for bond purposes only, did not evaluate Mr. Mattke
Service of Complaint admitted; Court confirms address & DOB on complaint are accurate; maximum penalties recited; reading waived

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Jennifer Langholff 
-No presence within 1000 feet of Ms. Langholff's residence

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by Defense and requested by State
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Count #1
Recess: 1:29 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing for 9/5/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
